publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3127 Linda Fabiani: Independence Day: East Timor-That the Parliament acknowledges the sacrifice and struggle of the people of Timor Loro Sae to achieve international recognition of nationhood; congratulates East Timor, which has a population of 800,000, on today, 20 May 2002, becoming the world's newest independent nation and looks forward to the day when Scotland also becomes a fully fledged member of the family of nations. Supported by: Mr Andrew Welsh*, Michael Matheson*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Kay Ullrich*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Stewart Stevenson*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Sandra White*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Brian Adam*, Alex Neil*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Fiona McLeod*, Irene McGugan*, Richard Lochhead*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Colin Campbell*, Fiona Hyslop*, Alasdair Morgan*, Michael Russell*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mr John Swinney*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Dennis Canavan*
